item.title: Vedic Mathematics
item.description: I wondered about what is “Vedic” about “Vedic Mathematics”.

item.title: Ali-Dashti on the Quran
item.description: Ali Dashti was born in 1896 in Dashtestan in Iran. At a young age, he was trained in Islamic theology, history, Arabic and Persian grammar, and classical literature in madrasas in Karbala and Najaf (both in Iraq).

item.title: Alberuni
item.description: The movements of Bīrūnī in India seem to have been modest. The word “Hindu” does not appear in Al Bīrūnī’s original Arabic text on religions of India.

item.title: Akbar
item.description: The following Dawn article published July 19, 2009 outlines the role played by historian I.H.Qureshi, S.M. Ikram in redefining history from the perspective of the two nation theory.

item.title: Punjabi in Pakistan
item.description: It is interesting to note that Abdus Salam, Nobel Prize winnner for Physics in 1979 gave his convocation address at Gurudev Nanak university of Amritsar on 25 January 1981 in rural Punjabi. He also received his Nobel Prize in traditional Punjabi attire. He needed some help in wrapping his turban around properly.
